alert.note: Alert for Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 4:55PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Converse County through 530 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Deer Creek, or 18 miles west of Douglas, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Glenrock, Rolling Hills, Rolling Hills Estates and Deer Creek. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 151 and 170. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Converse County Lower Elevations; North Laramie Range
